DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Ratio Prescription Isodose Volume To Planning Target Volume Index Performed Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the value associated with the breast planning target volume (PTV) EVAL conformity index.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Ratio Prescription Isodose Volume To Planning Target Volume Index Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to radiation therapy, the planning target volume (the precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to the concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects to the adjacent tissues) and the conformity index (a score expressing the relationship between irradiated tumor tissue and nonirradiated healthy tissues) performed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (RAY-dee-AY-shun) The use of high-energy radiation from x-rays, gamma rays, neutrons, and other sources to kill cancer cells and shrink tumors. Radiation may come from a machine outside the body (external-beam radiation therapy) or from materials called radioisotopes. Radioisotopes produce radiation and can be placed in or near the tumor or in the area near cancer cells. This type of radiation treatment is called internal radiation therapy, implant radiation, interstitial radiation, or brachytherapy. Systemic radiation therapy uses a radioactive substance, such as a radiolabeled monoclonal antibody, that circulates throughout the body.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredName: Ratio Prescription Isodose Volume To Planning Target Volume Index Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system. :A doctor's order for medicine or another intervention.:A radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area; of or relating to points or zones in a medium that receive equal doses of radiation.:The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues.:A numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number; a number used to select an element of a list, vector, array or other sequence.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure.
A radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area; of or relating to points or zones in a medium that receive equal doses of radiation.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.
A numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number; a number used to select an element of a list, vector, array or other sequence.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value associated with the breast planning target volume (PTV) EVAL conformity index.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form
